intro: Consolida hellespontica subsp. rosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its showy, rose-like clusters of white to pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, feathery leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its long blooming period, which extends from late spring to early autumn.
